item.title: Casa del Paprio Dipinto
item.description: Province Italia Italia (Pleiades) Location Herculaneum Herculaneum (Pleiades) Location Description An ancient Roman town of Campania destroyed by the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in A.D.79. Named as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997. Garden Casa del Paprio Dipinto ##Jashemski Catalogue 544.IV.8-9. Keywords impluvium Garden Description 544.IV.8-9. This narrow house excavated in 1929-1932 had a small paved courtyard serving as both a light well and an impluvium. This area could have held potted plants. A hunt scene once decorated the back wall, featuring lions and bulls, scenes more typically found on the walls of more luxurious dwellings.
